components.name: Layer Name
components.description: A display name for the layer.

components.name: Kind of Layer
components.description: A special kind of interaction for the layer. Please see the Kinds page in the documentation for more.

components.name: Initial Visibility
components.description: Whether the layer is on initially.

components.name: URL
components.description: A file path that points to a geojson. If the path is relative, it will be relative to the mission's directory. The URL must contain a proper placeholder ending such as: {z}/{x}/{y}.png. Alternatively vectors can be served with Geodatasets. Simply go to 'Manage Geodatasets' at the bottom left, upload a geojson and link to it in this URL field with 'geodatasets:{geodataset*name}'

components.name: Minimum Zoom
components.description: The lowest (smallest number) zoom level for which to show this layer. If the current Map's zoom level is less than this, the layer will not be rendered even if the layer is still on.

components.name: Maximum Zoom
components.description: The highest (greatest number) zoom level for which to show this layer. If the current Map's zoom level is higher/deeper than this, the layer will not be rendered even if the layer is still on.

components.name: 3D Layer Type
components.description: Whether, in the Globe, to clamp this layer onto the ground textures or to represent with sprites and line objects.

components.name: Initial Opacity
components.description: A value from 0 (transparent) to 1 (opaque) of the layer's initial opacity.

components.name: Color
components.description: The border color of each feature. If the feature is a line, this field is the color of the line.

components.name: Color From Property
components.description: Color but taken from each individual feature's property. For example 'color' or 'path.to.prop.in.properties.object'. Takes priority over the value in the 'Color' field.

components.name: Opacity
components.description: Stroke Opacity

components.name: Opacity From Property
components.description: Opacity but taken from each individual feature's property. For example 'opacity' or 'path.to.prop.in.properties.object'. Takes priority over the value in the 'Opacity' field.

components.name: Fill Color
components.description: Fill Color

components.name: Fill Color From Property
components.description: Fill Color but taken from each individual feature's property. For example 'fill_color' or 'path.to.prop.in.properties.object'. Takes priority over the value in the 'Fill Color' field.

components.name: Fill Opacity
components.description: Fill Opacity

components.name: Fill Opacity From Property
components.description: Fill Opacity but taken from each individual feature's property. For example 'fill_opacity' or 'path.to.prop.in.properties.object'. Takes priority over the value in the 'Fill Opacity' field.

components.name: Weight
components.description: Stroke weight in pixels of point features.

components.name: Weight From Property
components.description: Weight but taken from each individual feature's property. For example 'weight' or 'path.to.prop.in.properties.object'. Takes priority over the value in the 'Weight' field.

components.name: Radius
components.description: Radius in pixels of point features.

components.name: Radius From Property
components.description: Radius but taken from each individual feature's property. For example 'radius' or 'path.to.prop.in.properties.object'. Takes priority over the value in the 'Radius' field.

components.name: Vector Tile Feature Unique Id Key
components.description: Each feature of the vector tileset needs a property with a unique value to identify it. This required field is the name of that property.

components.name: Vector Tile Use Key as Name
components.description: (Optional) The property key whose value should be the hover text of each feature.

components.name: Shape
components.description: A marker symbol for point features for this layer. When set to 'None', a simple circle is used. Marker icons and other attachments may override this setting.

components.name: Vector Tile Style
components.description: Vector Tiles are styled differently than Vectors. Raw variables here takes an object that maps internal vector tile layer names to styles. All raw variables are optional.

rows.subdescription: Uses an icon image instead of an svg for all of the layer's point markers. If you're using this as a bearing marker, make sure the base icon is pointing north.

components.name: Icon URL
components.description: A URL to an image to use as a marker icon.

components.name: Shadow URL
components.description: An optional URL to an image to use as a marker icon's shadow..

components.name: Icon X Size
components.description: Pixel width of the icon's image.

components.name: Icon Y Size
components.description: Pixel height of the icon's image.

components.name: Shadow X Size
components.description: Pixel width of the icon's shadow.

components.name: Shadow Y Size
components.description: Pixel height of the icon's shadow.

components.name: Icon X Anchor
components.description: X point of the icon which will correspond to marker's center location.

components.name: Icon Y Anchor
components.description: Y point of the icon which will correspond to marker's center location.

components.name: Shadow X Anchor
components.description: X point of the shadow which will correspond to marker's center location.

components.name: Shadow Y Anchor
components.description: Y point of the shadow which will correspond to marker's center location.

components.name: Time Enabled
components.description: True if the layer is time enabled. URLs that contain {starttime} or {endtime} will be dynamically replaced by their set values when the layer is fetched. If true and a URL is set and Controlled is true, only the initial url query will be performed.

components.name: Time Type
components.description: When the time changes, whether the layer should requery the source or filter the layer locally based on feature properties.

components.name: Time Format
components.description: The string format to be used in the URL for {starttime} and {endtime}. Uses D3 time format specifiers: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format. Default: %Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ

components.name: Start Time Property Name
components.description: Optional and only in use if Time Enabled = true and Time Type = Local. The starting time property path. Setting this is addition to Main Time Property Name casts the feature's time over a range instead of as a single point in time. Can use dot-notation for nested path. Can be a unix timestamp or an ISO time (end the ISO with a Z to designate that it should be treated as a UTC time).

components.name: Main/End Time Property Name
components.description: Required in Time Enabled = true and Time Type = Local. The main time property path. Can use dot-notation for nested path. Can be a unix timestamp or an ISO time (end the ISO with a Z to designate that it should be treated as a UTC time).

components.name: Legend From URL
components.description: A URL to a .csv with the following header: 'color,strokecolor,shape,value'. If the path is relative, it will be relative to the mission's directory. This legend is overridden if a legend is also configured below.

components.name: Legend
components.description: Configures a legend for the layer. The Legend Tool renders symbologies and gradient scales for any properly configured layer that is on.

object.name: Fill Color
object.description: A color for the main fill of the symbol.

object.name: Border Color
object.description: A stroke/border color. Note that 'discreet' and 'continuous' shapes have no borders.

object.name: Shape
object.description: The symbol for which to us for this legend entry. Discreet and continuous describe scales. These scales are broken into groups by a change in shape value. For instance, 'discreet, discreet, discreet, circle, discreet, discreet' represents a discreet scales of three colors, a circle and then a discreet scale of two colors.

object.name: Label
object.description: A label description for this legend entry.

rows.name: Interface
rows.subdescription: The property key whose value should be the hover text of each feature. If left unset, the hover key and value will be the first one listed in the feature's properties.

components.name: Alt + {letter} Toggle Shortcut
components.description: A single letter to 'ALT + {letter}' toggle the layer on and off. Please verify that your chosen shortcut does not conflict with other system or browser-level keyboard shortcuts.

components.name: Search Construct
components.description: When set, this layer will become searchable through the search bar at the top. The search will look for and autocomplete on the properties specified. All properties are enclosed by parentheses and space-separated. 'round()' can be used like a function to round the property beforehand. 'rmunder()' works similarly but removes all underscores instead. For example: '(RMC) rmunder(sol)'

components.name: External Links
components.description: Configure deep links to other sites based on the properties on a selected feature. Upon clicking a feature, a list of deep links are put into the top bar and can be clicked on to navigate to any other page.

object.name: Display Name
object.description: The name of the deep link. It should be unique.

object.name: URL
object.description: A url template. Curly brackets are included. On feature click, all '{prop}' are replaced with the corresponding features[i].properties.prop value. Multiple '{prop}' are supported as an access to nested props using dot notation '{stores.food.candy}'.

components.name: TopBar Information
components.description: Creates an informational record at the top of the page. The first use case was showing the value of the latest sol. Clicking this record pans to the feature specified by 'which'. This is used on startup and not when a user selects a feature in this layer.

object.name: Information Construct
object.description: A name to display. All '{prop}'s will be replaced by their corresponding features[which].properties[prop] value.

object.name: Icon Name
object.description: Any Material Design Icon name: https://pictogrammers.com/library/mdi/

object.name: From Feature
object.description: This only supports the value 'last' at this point meaning that the properties from the last feature in the layer while be used to populate the information in the TopBar.

object.name: Go
object.description: if true, pans and zooms to the feature of which on initial load. The zoom used is Map Scale Zoom or the current zoom. In the case of multiple layers configured with 'Go', only the first feature with info.go is gone to.

rows.name: Information
rows.subdescription: Assign tags to this layer so that they may be searched upon through the LayersTool. A category may be specified with the following pattern: 'category:tag'
A freeform markdown description of the layer. In the LayersTool, users may click the information icon beside the layer's name to view this information.

components.name: Enabled
components.description: If true, tries to only query the vector features present in the user's current map viewport. This can be very performant for large vector datasets especially if minimum and maximum zooms are set for the layer. Pan and zooming causes requeries. If used with a geodataset, the time and extent queries will work out-of-the-box. Otherwise, if using an external server, the following parameters in {} will be automatically replaced on query in the url: 'starttime={starttime}&endtime={endtime}&startprop={startprop}&endprop={endprop}&crscode={crscode}&zoom={zoom}&minx={minx}&miny={miny}&maxx={maxx}&maxy={maxy}'. This setting is not advised if the data source is a straight geojson file because it expects a server that can crop the data to given extents.

components.name: Threshold
components.description: If dynamicExtent is true, only requery if the map was panned past the stated threshold. Unit is in meters. If a zoom-dependent threshold is desired, set this value to a string ending in '/z'. This will then internally use 'dynamicExtentMoveThreshold / Math.pow(2, zoom)' as the threshold value.

components.name: Disable Interactivity
components.description: If checked, no mouse events will trigger on features of this layer.

components.name: Connections
components.description: Datasets are csvs uploaded from the 'Manage Datasets' page accessible on the lower left. Every time a feature from this layer is clicked with datasetLinks configured, it will request the data from the server and include it with it's regular geojson properties. This is especially useful when single features need a lot of metadata to perform a task as it loads it only as needed. A unique value needs to be present in both the feature's 'prop'erties and in the dataset's 'column' in order to combine the metadata.

object.name: Dataset Name
object.description: The name of a dataset to link to. A list of datasets can be found in the 'Manage Datasets' page.

object.name: Connecting Dataset Column
object.description: This is a column/csv header name within the dataset. If the value of the prop key matches the value in this column, the entire row will be return. All rows that match are returned.

object.name: Connecting Feature Property
object.description: This is a property key already within the features properties. It's value will be searched for in the specified dataset column.

components.name: Enabled
components.description: Place a label beside each feature. Also applies to 'Coordinate Attachments -> Marker' features.

components.name: Initial Visibility
components.description: Whether the label sublayer is initially on. Users can toggle sublayers on and off in the layer settings in the LayersTool.

components.name: Theme
components.description: Label theme. Either default or solid. Default is white text with a black border. Solid is white text with a dark-grey background box.

components.name: Size
components.description: Label size. Either default or large. Default is 14px, large is 16px.

components.name: Enabled
components.description: Links cross-layer features together. Features paired to this layer will attempt to compute the azimuth-elevation relationship between the two to draw in the Viewer's PhotoSphere. Additionally, on the Map, a line will be drawn between the two features.

components.name: Initial Visibility
components.description: Whether the pairing line sublayer is initially on. Users can toggle sublayers on and off in the layer settings in the LayersTool.

components.name: Layers with which to Pair
components.description: An comma-separated array of names or UUIDs of other layers.

components.name: Pair Property
components.description: The dot.notated path to the feature properties that contains the property to pair on. This layer and all paired layers need this property to properly pair up. A feature in this layer is said to be paired with a feature of one of the other specified layers, if and only if the values of this property in both features matches.

components.name: Layer Azimuth Property
components.description: The dot.notated path to the feature properties that contains the features' azimuth. If unset, the azimuth will be calculated through the feature's longitude, latitude, elevation coordinates.

components.name: Layer Elevation Property
components.description: The dot notated path to the feature properties that contains the features' elevation. If unset, the elevation will be calculated through the feature's longitude, latitude, elevation coordinates.

components.name: Origin Offset Order
components.description: In many cases, a marker's center is not the camera's center. Within a feature's 'properties.images' objects, 'originOffset' can be defined. 'originOffsetOrder' describes the XYZ order and signage that 'originOffset' should be read in. Possible values are X, -X, Y, -Y, Z, -Z. Example value: 'X,Y,-Z'

components.name: Pairing Line Color
components.description: The color of the line to drawn between paired features that indicate their connectivity.

components.name: Pairing Line Weight
components.description: The weight (thickness) of the line to drawn between paired features that indicate their connectivity.

components.name: Enabled
components.description: Place a marker at every coordinate of every feature.

components.name: Initial Visibility
components.description: Whether the coordinate marker sublayer is initially on. Users can toggle sublayers on and off in the layer settings in the LayersTool.

components.name: Color
components.description: A stroke/border color for the markers.

components.name: Opacity
components.description: A stroke/border opacity for the markers.

components.name: Fill Color
components.description: A fill color for the markers.

components.name: Fill Opacity
components.description: A fill opacity for the markers.

components.name: Weight
components.description: A stroke thickness in pixels for the markers.

components.name: Radius
components.description: A radius in pixels for the markers.

components.name: Enabled
components.description: Sets a bearing direction (clockwise from north) of this layer's point markers (or markerIcons if set). Overrides the layer's shape dropdown value.

components.name: Angle Property
components.description: The dot.notated path to the feature properties that contains the desired rotation angle. Ex. headings.yaw.

components.name: Angle Unit
components.description: Unit of the value of 'angleProp'.

components.name: Color
components.description: A color for the directional arrow for non-markerIcon bearings.

components.name: Enabled
components.description: Places a scaled and orientated image under each marker.

components.name: Image URL
components.description: A url to a (preferably) top-down north-facing orthographic image.

components.name: Image URL Property
components.description: A prop.path to an image url. This takes priority over 'Image URL' and is useful if the path is feature specific.

components.name: Initial Visibility
components.description: Whether the image sublayer is initially on. Users can toggle sublayers on and off in the layer settings in the LayersTool.

components.name: Initial Opacity
components.description: The initial image opacity. Users can change sublayer opacity n the layer settings in the LayersTool. From 0 to 1.

components.name: Width in Meters
components.description: Width of image in meters in order to calculate scale.

components.name: Pixels Wide
components.description: Image width in pixels.

components.name: Pixels High
components.description: Image height in pixels.

components.name: Angle Property
components.description: Prop path to the rotation of the image

components.name: Angle Unit
components.description: The units of 'Angle Property'.

components.name: Shown
components.description: If set to 'always', overrides the Waypoints Kind (if set) and always renders the image under the marker. 'click' just shows the image on click and requires the layer to have the Waypoints Kind.

components.name: Enabled
components.description: Render a model in the 3D Globe for the point features of this layer.

components.name: Model URL
components.description: A path to model. The following model formats are supported: .dae, .glb, .gltf, and .obj.

components.name: Model URL Property
components.description: A prop.path to a model. This takes priority over 'Model URL' and is useful if model is feature specific.

components.name: Yaw Property
components.description: Prop path to the model's yaw. If this value is a number, uses it directly.

components.name: Yaw Unit
components.description: The units of 'Yaw Property'.

components.name: Invert Yaw
components.description: If true, multiplies yaw by -1.

components.name: Pitch Property
components.description: Prop path to the model's pitch. If this value is a number, uses it directly.

components.name: Pitch Unit
components.description: The units of 'Pitch Property'.

components.name: Invert Pitch
components.description: If true, multiplies pitch by -1.

components.name: Roll Property
components.description: Prop path to the model's roll. If this value is a number, uses it directly.

components.name: Roll Unit
components.description: The units of 'Roll Property'.

components.name: Invert Roll
components.description: If true, multiplies roll by -1.

components.name: Elevation Property
components.description: Prop path to the model's elevation (in meters). If this value is a number, uses it directly. Default 0.

components.name: Scale Property
components.description: Prop path to the model's scale. If this value is a number, uses it directly. Default 1.

components.name: Shown
components.description: If set to 'always', always renders the model at the marker. 'click' just shows the model on-click

components.name: Only on Last N
components.description: If 0, shows models at all points. If a number, only shows models for the last n points of the layer.

components.name: Enabled
components.description: Turns on a sublayer feature that places ellipses about point features in order to indicate positional uncertainties.

components.name: Initial Visibility
components.description: Whether the uncertainty sublayer is initially on. Users can toggle sublayers on and off in the layer settings in the LayersTool.

components.name: Stroke Color
components.description: A stroke/border color for the uncertainty ellipse. Defaults to 'black'.

components.name: Stroke Opacity
components.description: A stroke/border opacity for the uncertainty ellipse. 0 (transparent) to 1 (opaque).

components.name: Fill Color
components.description: A fill color for the uncertainty ellipse. It will appear more transparent than set. Defaults to 'white'.

components.name: Fill Opacity
components.description: A fill opacity for the uncertainty ellipse. 0 (transparent) to 1 (opaque).

components.name: Weight
components.description: A stroke/border weight for the uncertainty ellipse.

components.name: 3D Color
components.description: A color for the ellipse's vertical curtain in the 3D Globe. Can be an array for a vertical gradient: 'rgba(0,0,0,0), #26A8FF'.

components.name: 3D Opacity
components.description: A fill opacity for the ellipse's vertical curtain in the 3D Globe. 0 (transparent) to 1 (opaque).

components.name: 3D Depth
components.description: A depth, in meters, for the ellipse's vertical curtain in the 3D Globe. Defaults to 2.

components.name: X-Axis Property
components.description: Prop path to the x-axis radius value of the ellipse.

components.name: Y-Axis Property
components.description: Prop path to the y-axis radius value of the ellipse.

components.name: Axis Unit
components.description: The units of 'X-Axis Property' and 'Y-Axis Property'.

components.name: Angle Property
components.description: Prop path to the rotation of the ellipse.

components.name: Angle Unit
components.description: The units of 'Angle Property'.

components.name: Enabled
components.description: Renders a 'hotline' gradient for visualizing value changes along a path. Useful with 'Miscellaneous -> Hide Main Features'. Look into 'Enhanced GeoJSON' in the docs on how to format layers with properties-per-coordinate.

components.name: Color With Property
components.description: Prop path to the value's key to visualize.

components.name: Dropdown Color With Properties
components.description: Array of additional prop paths. Users can toggle between value properties in the LayersTool. 'Color With Property's path is automatically added here if not already included.

components.name: Color Ramp
components.description: Array of css colors indicating the color ramp. The first color represents the min value and the last color represents the max value in the layer.

components.name: Weight
components.description: Line thickness in pixels.

components.name: Chemistry Values
components.description: Comma-separated chemistry columns to use as percentages and in what order. Should be used with a Dataset. Ex. 'Al2O3,CaO,FeOT,K2O,MgO,Na2O,SiO2,TiO2'. Look into the docs for the ChemistryTool for more information.

components.name: Hide Main Features
components.description: If true, hides all typically rendered features. This is useful if showing only the 'Attachments' of layers is desired and not their features themselves.
